post.title: Meet Fade Ogunro: Founder of Bookings Africa
post.excerpt: Fade Ogunro is the founder and CEO of Bookings Africa, an online talent service provider in Africa.
post.content:
Fade Ogunro is the founder and CEO of Bookings Africa, an online talent service provider in Africa. She also serves as the Africa Chairperson for the Cherie Blair Foundation for Women, a foundation that helps discover women entrepreneurs in low and middle-income countries, where she develops initiatives that directly empower women to start, sustain, and grow successful businesses. So far, over 45,000 women in Nigeria have been impacted. 

Fade started her career in 2011 as the co-founder of Film Factory Productions, a company that created content for brands like Microsoft, Coca-Cola, MTV, etc. In 2018, she founded Bookings Africa, a gig marketplace that offers virtual and physical services. 

The mission of Bookings Africa is to reduce unemployment and encourage creativity among African youths. As of 2021, the platform has over 250,000 app downloads and 85,000 registered users in Nigeria, Kenya, and South Africa.

When asked by Lioness of Africa what the biggest piece of advice she can give to other women looking to start up is, she said: “My advice to women looking to start up is to Measure twice, cut once. I advise you to know as much as you can about your business so as to put your best forward when you finally get started”. 

She hopes Bookings Africa will be the preferred digital work platform in Africa and scale up to 15-20 African countries in the next 5-10 years with over 3 million active users with more professions.

node.title: Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua has become the first black woman to hold a PhD in Cybernetics
node.excerpt: An award-winning Nigerian Professor, Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua, has emerged as the first black woman in the world to earn a doctorate (PhD) in Cybernetics, which is the scientific study of control and communication in animals and machines, concerned with understanding complex systems like learning, cognition, adaptation, emergence, communication, and efficiency. node.title: Tech Sales vs Business Development
node.excerpt: Tech sales and Business development are important for generating revenue for companies in the tech industry. While both of them play the same role of contributing to the company’s growth, they do it in a different way and timeframe. Tech sales focus on closing deals with different customers, while business development creates new business opportunities […]
